intro: Heteropterys gayana f. acapulcensis, commonly known as the Acapulco huito, is a shrub native to southern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by edible, fleshy fruits resembling small, green oranges. Its botanical features make it an important species in local ecosystems and traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, tropical climates and is often found in cloud forests.
